publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: Y08BP11# 1 FAir ones! to you who Hearts Command,Y08BP11# 2 And gently sway with Fan in Hand,Y08BP11# 3 Your fav'rite PUNCH a suppliant fallsY08BP11# 4 And humbly for Assistance calls;Y08BP11# 5 He humbly calls and begs you'll stop,Y08BP11# 6 The Gothick Rage of Vanderhop,Y08BP11# 7 Who invades without pretence or rightY08BP11# 8 Or any Law but that of Might,Y08BP11# 9 Our Pigmy Land, and Treats our Kings,Y08BP11# 10 Like Paultry, Idle, Wodden things.Y08BP11# 11 Has beat our Dancers out of Doors,Y08BP11# 12 And call'd our chasest Virgins Whores,Y08BP11# 13 He has not left our Queen a Ragg onY08BP11# 14 Has forc'd our George away and Dragon,Y08BP11# 15 Has broke our Wires, nor was he CivilY08BP11# 16 To Dr. Faustus or the Devil;Y08BP11# 17 Even me he hurry'd with full Rage,Y08BP11# 18 Most hoarsly Squaling off the Stage.Y08BP11# 19
And faith our Fright was very great; Y08BP11# 20 To see a Minister of State,Y08BP11# 21 Arm'd with Power and Fury come,Y08BP11# 22 To force us from our little Home.Y08BP11# 23

We fear'd (as I am sure we'd Reason) Y08BP11# 24 An Accusation of High-Treason,Y08BP11# 25 Till starting up says BANDIMERE,Y08BP11# 26 Treason my Friends we need not fear,Y08BP11# 27 For 'gainst the BRASS we us'd no PowerY08BP11# 28 Nor strove to save the CHANCELLOUR,Y08BP11# 29 Nor did we shew the least AffectionY08BP11# 30 To ROCHFORD, on the Meath Election:Y08BP11# 31 Nor did we Sing────Mc'·Hugh he Means,Y08BP11# 32 Ye Villain I'll dash out your Brains:Y08BP11# 33 Tis no Affair of State that brings.Y08BP11# 34 Me here! nor Business of the Kings:Y08BP11# 35 I come to seize you all as Debtors,Y08BP11# 36 And bind you fast in Iron Fetters,Y08BP11# 37 From sight of every Friend in Town,Y08BP11# 38 Till Fifty Pounds to me paid down:Y08BP11# 39 Fifty Quoth I, a devilish Sum,Y08BP11# 40 But stay till the Brass Farthings come,Y08BP11# 41 Then we shall all be rich as Jews.Y08BP11# 42 From Castle down to lowest Hews,Y08BP11# 43 That Sum shall then be to you toldY08BP11# 44 Tho' now we cannot furnish Gold,Y08BP11# 45 Y08BP11# 46 Y08BP11# 47 Quoth he! thou Vile Mishapen Beast;Y08BP11# 48 Thou Knave, am I become thy Jest,Y08BP11# 49 Y08BP11# 50 Y08BP11# 51 Thou Fool, I ne'er do things by halves,Y08BP11# 52 Farthings were made for Irish Slaves:Y08BP11# 53 No Brass for me────it must be GOLD,Y08BP11# 54 Or fifty Pounds in Silver told,Y08BP11# 55 That can by any means obtain,Y08BP11# 56 Freedom for thee and for thy Train:Y08BP11# 57

Votre tres humble Serviteur, Y08BP11# 58 I'm not in Jest (said I) I'm sure:Y08BP11# 59 But from the bottom of my Belly,Y08BP11# 60 I in sober sadness tell ye?Y08BP11# 61 I thought it was good ReasoningY08BP11# 62 In us fictitious Men to bring:Y08BP11# 63 Brass Counters made by William Wood,Y08BP11# 64 Which might as well be Understood,Y08BP11# 65 Intrinsick as we Flesh and Blood.Y08BP11# 66 Then since we are but mimick Men,Y08BP11# 67 Pray let us Pay in Mimick Coin.Y08BP11# 68 Y08BP11# 69 Y08BP11# 70 Y08BP11# 71 Y08BP11# 72 Y08BP11# 73 Y08BP11# 74 Y08BP11# 75 Y08BP11# 76 Y08BP11# 77 Y08BP11# 78 Y08BP11# 79 Y08BP11# 80 Y08BP11# 81 Y08BP11# 82 Y08BP11# 83 Y08BP11# 84 Y08BP11# 85 Y08BP11# 86 Quoth he, thou lovest PUNCH to prate,Y08BP11# 87 And could for ever hold Debate,Y08BP11# 88 But think'st thou that I've, naught to do;Y08BP11# 89 But to stand prating here with you,Y08BP11# 90 Therefore to stop your noisy Parly.Y08BP11# 91 I at once assure you fairly,Y08BP11# 92 That not a Puppet of you all,Y08BP11# 93 Shall stir a step without this Wall,Y08BP11# 94 Nor Merry Andrew beat his Drum,Y08BP11# 95 Untill you've paid the aforesaid Sum.Y08BP11# 96 Then Marching off with swiftest Pace,Y08BP11# 97 To write Dispatches for his Grace,Y08BP11# 98 The Revel Master left the Room,Y08BP11# 99 And us Condemn'd to fatal Doom,Y08BP11# 100 Now Ladies if I e'er found Grace.Y08BP11# 101 Or that my Jokes did ever please,Y08BP11# 102 Use all your Intrest with the SEC.Y08BP11# 103 They say he's at the Ladies beck,Y08BP11# 104 And tho' he thirsts as much for Gold.Y08BP11# 105 As ever MIDIS did of Old:Y08BP11# 106 Your Charms I'm sure can never fail.Y08BP11# 107 Your's must Influence, must prevail,Y08BP11# 108 At your Request he'll set us free.Y08BP11# 109 Let us to you owe Liberty,Y08BP11# 110 Get us a Licence now to Play,Y08BP11# 111 And we in Duty Bound will Pray:
